clinical_study.brief_title: Objective EEG Bed Side Assessment of Impaired Conscious Awareness in Epilepsy
clinical_study.official_title: Objective EEG Bed Side Assessment of Impaired Conscious Awareness in Epilepsy

brief_summary.textblock: In this project EEG recordings between healthy participants and those with a diagnosed Absence-epilepsy will be compared. The investigators suggest differences in EEG microstate analysis and neuropsychological parameters related to interictal cognitive impairment in these patients. This projects goal is to derive an EEG-based measure of conscious awareness.

primary_outcome.measure: temporal integration changes according to different sleep states
primary_outcome.description: The investigators develop an EEG-based measure of impaired conscious awareness based on wakefulness and deepening sleep stages which will serve as a model for increasingly impaired conscious awareness. By performing a microstate analysis on EEG data, the investigators hypothesize a decrease of the temporal integration, a prerequisite for conscious awareness, of the EEG gradually from wakefulness to deep sleep.

primary_outcome.measure: temporal integration changes in interictal EEG
primary_outcome.description: The investigators apply the aforementioned analysis (leading to Outcome 1) on interictal EEG recordings obtained from patients with diagnosed absence epilepsy. The investigators hypothesize a reduced temporal integration in epilepsies with reduced consciousness.

primary_outcome.measure: graph modularity changes according to different sleep states
primary_outcome.description: The investigators will calculate the EEG-based functional connectivity and graph modularity for each sleep state. The investigators hypothesize that during wakefulness, graph modularity will be lower than during the descent to sleep.

primary_outcome.measure: graph modularity changes in interictal EEG
primary_outcome.description: The investigators will calculate the EEG-based functional connectivity and graph modularity for the absence epilepsy condition. The investigators hypothesize that impaired consciousness will be reflected in lower graph modularity compared to healthy subjects.

secondary_outcome.description: The investigators hypothesize that the graph modularity level correlates with neuropsychological test scores in the surveyed data of epilepsy patients.

arm_group.description: Age-matched healthy participants will be recruited via flyers at public education facilities and online advertisement. Participants need to be healthy and without central nervous system disorders and substance abuse. The investigators will also exclude pregnant women from the experiment.

Apart from the diagnosis of epilepsy, patients need to be of good health and without central nervous system disorders and substance abuse. The investigators will also exclude pregnant women from the experiment.

study_pop.textblock: Patients with diagnosed absence epilepsy at least 18 years old; age-matched controls.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- age minimum 18 years
- diagnosis of (absence) epilepsy // healthy age-matched controls
- being of good health (besides epilepsy in the case group)
Exclusion Criteria:
- central nervous system disorders (besides epilepsy in the case group)
- substance abuse
- pregnancy

patient_data.ipd_description: Analysis protocols and analysis scripts will be shared between this studies collaborators through a public platform, probably GitHub.
